item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It is awfully easy to be hard-boiled about everything in the daytime, but at night it is another thing." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "His talent was as natural as the pattern that was made by the dust on a butterfly's wings. At one time he understood it no more than the butterfly did and he did not know when it was brushed or marred. Later he became conscious of his damaged wings and of their construction and he learned to think and could not fly any more because the love of flight was gone and he could only remember when it had been effortless." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "I love sleep. My life has the tendency to fall apart when I'm awake, you know?" -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "It's none of their business that you have to learn how to write. Let them think you were born that way." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All you have to do is write one true sentence. Write the truest sentence that you know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no rule on how to write. Sometimes it comes easily and perfectly; sometimes it's like drilling rock and then blasting it out with charges." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Tessa add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "My tongue will tell the anger of my heart, or else my heart concealing it will break." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When he shall die, Take him and cut him out in little stars, And he will make the face of heaven so fine That all the world will be in love with night And pay no worship to the garish sun." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "To weep is to make less the depth of grief." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Our doubts are traitors, and make us lose the good we oft might win, by fearing to attempt." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "He that hath a beard is more than a youth, and he that hath no beard is less than a man. He that is more than a youth is not for me, and he that is less than a man, I am not for him." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Me, poor man, my library Was dukedom large enough." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Why, man, he doth bestride the narrow world Like a Colossus; and we petty men Walk under his huge legs, and peep about To find ourselves dishonourable graves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Some Cupid kills with arrows, some with traps. " -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "it provokes the desire, but it takes away the performance" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Men have died from time to time, and worms have eaten them, but not for love." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "And to be merry best becomes you; for, out of question, you were born in a merry hour. BEATRICE No, sure, my lord, my mother cried; but then there was a star danced, and under that was I born." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The robb'd that smiles, steals something from the thief; He robs himself that spends a bootless grief." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "There's a divinity that shapes our ends, Rough-hew them how we will." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "We burn daylight." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Tessa add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Hell is empty and all the devils are here." -- William Shakespeare
